data.title: Fix activatePackages
data.body: When a package having `activationHooks` exists, `did-activate-initial-packages` is not called.

data.title: Switching desktops in OS X makes text cursor change to normal cursor (fullscreen mode).
data.body:
![atombug1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2590174/11020375/80a5e8f6-861e-11e5-8ed8-64a86dc23b7a.gif)

When Atom is in fullscreen mode and you click on some text in Atom, you can see a text cursor. That's correct. But when you switch to other desktop, and then switch to Atom again, the cursor is not a text cursor. Even clicking on the text again doesn't change that. The only workaround is to move the cursor to some other widget, and then move it over text area again.

Atom 1.1.0, OS X 10.11

data.title: Random bubble pops up on text.
data.body: I am not sure if this is the right place to post this. But this issue has become extremely annoying. What is that pop up?? and how do I stop it? thanks!

data.title: Creates new line when saving
data.body:
I have just installed Atom 1.1.0 and I have noticed that whenever I am using CTRL-S and saves the file I am on, Atom creates a newline at the bottom before saving.

It doesn't matter what file type it is.

It should not create newlines when saving.

data.title: [1.2.0-beta1] When a search has many results, listings are not rendered around the halfway point.
data.body: Version 1.2.0-beta1 on OSX El Capitan. And One Dark/Light Theme. Does not appear to be an issue in 1.1.0. Seems to work with other themes too.

data.title: Disable throttling in test windows via WebAudio hack
data.body:
Throttling in test windows is annoying when tests run interactively, and _seems_ to cause issues with animation frames not firing even in headless tests, though it’s difficult to fully confirm since this issue is intermittent.

Refs atom/electron#3225
/cc @zcbenz

data.title: Remove subpixel-font-scaling option
data.body: This option was removed in Electron v0.33.9, and we're on v0.34.0 now (soon to be v0.34.3).

data.title: Show non breaking space if showInvisibles is true
data.body: Fixes #8080

data.title: Upgrade Electron To 0.34.3
data.body:
- Fixes Windows Overflow On `process.exit` (Causing apm To Always Fail) https://github.com/atom/electron/releases/tag/v0.34.3
- Fixes Excessive Console Logging On Windows: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8957 / https://github.com/atom/electron/releases/tag/v0.34.1

data.title: Adjust icon size for small buttons
data.body:
This PR makes the icons in small and extra small buttons a bit smaller too. Fixes #8412

Before:

![screen shot 2015-11-07 at 9 52 47 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/11015248/f0e8f7e6-8599-11e5-823b-c1175377df8d.png)

After:

![screen shot 2015-11-07 at 9 50 42 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/11015249/f817b6d8-8599-11e5-92e4-3061734e3fef.png)

Screenshots are with core styles only (no theme).

data.title: After removing second monitor Atom can become unusable
data.body:
Bug appears on Windows
1. Move Atom window to second monitor and maximize it
2. Close Atom
3. Remove second monitor
4. Open Atom
Result: Atom spawns outside of 1st monitor and cannot be moved inside. In other words, Atom becomes unusable; deleting data in %APPDATA% doesn't help.

data.title: Add Windows CI
data.body:
## Done
- [x] Add Windows CI via Appveyor
- [x] Pave the road for releases to be generated from Appveyor (Windows)
- [x] Make various improvements to script/cibuild and build/Gruntfile.coffee
- [x] Add caching of `~/.atom/.npm`, `~/.atom/.apm`, and `~/.atom/.node-gyp` on Appveyor
## Future
- [ ] Pave the road for releases to be generated from Travis (OSX / Linux)
- [ ] Provide a pathway for Node v4.2.1 / apm 1.5.x, but do not make them the default for internal Atom CI
- [ ] Add caching of `~/.atom/.npm`, `~/.atom/.apm`, and `~/.atom/.node-gyp` on Travis
- [ ] Make remoteReleases synchronization faster
- [ ] Add caching of electron
- [ ] Add caching of node in `https://github.com/atom/apm/blob/master/script/download-node.js`
- [ ] Create zip archive for Windows
- [ ] Add artifacts explicitly instead of all of `atom-build`
- [ ] Disable `0.10.35` builds on Windows (we now know they work)
- [ ] Add `signtool` tool
- [ ] Add encrypted ATOM_ACCESS_TOKEN to .travis.yml, with scopes necessary for release upload
- [ ] Fix .deb package generation
- [ ] Add encrypted signing keys for Travis and Appveyor, with corresponding encrypted variable

data.title: Always set devMode to true for spec windows
data.body: Otherwise dev mode isn't enabled when running specs interactively, which can have unintended consequences.

data.title: ctrl+alt+r results in menu disappearing in Ubuntu on Unity
data.body: When reloading the Window with `CTRL+ALT+R` on Ubuntu the application menu disappears until truly restarting Atom by closing it and re-opening it.

data.title: atom crashes if you try to open any files in webkit.js repo
data.body: If you clone https://github.com/trevorlinton/webkit.js, start atom in it (with or without the `--safe` flag), it appears to start up fine and lists files in the left file list, but as soon as you open any of them, Atom freezes for a few seconds, and then a dialog appears "The editor has crashed. Please report this issue to https://github.com/atom/atom. [Keep It Open] [Reload] [Close]".

data.title: Option to disable autocomplete for snippet parameters
data.body:
I can only speak for myself but for me having to press escape 3+ times for a simple snippet as you're stepping through params makes it pretty unusable. It would be awesome to have an option to disable auto-complete when you're stepping through a snippet.

cheers

data.title: Attempting to use Atom with `fc` or `Ctrl+x,Ctrl+e` for editing command line results in hang
data.body:
Given `export EDITOR="atom -nw --safe"`, attempting to run `fc` to edit a command from Bash's history results in Atom hanging and periodically popping up the dialog "Editor is not responding" with the "Keep Waiting" and "Cancel" options.

I'm not sure what's special about this "file" Atom is having troubles opening, but it's frustrating. The file path is `/var/folders/2v/9v_j3kn952d31p19cpz0t37c0000gn/T`

data.title: Async repo take 2
data.body:
After implementing almost everything else in #9213, I ran into some
sporadic spec failures that I was having trouble reasoning about. This
is an attempt to start over with the class _beginning_ with the
functionality that went flaky, to better understand how it is tested
and whether it was being broken by an interaction with something else
in the new implementation, broken intrinsically, or had buggy tests.

This may supersede the other PR, or it may not. Let’s see what we learn.

Also, the spec is written in es6 and not coffee in this branch, and I do plan to take Nathan’s advice and update it to use async/await rather than the jasmine queue.

cc @joshaber

data.title: Make LanguageMode::unfoldAll faster
data.body:
_All the benchmarks were performed by opening `src/text-editor.coffee` on startup_.

In the previous implementation we were constantly querying `TextBuffer` for folds whenever the grammar on `TextEditor` changed:

![screen shot 2015-11-06 at 14 29 22](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/10998082/d9b7339c-8492-11e5-8f34-014d780743f2.png)

Indeed, when changing the grammar we issue a call to `LanguageMode::unfoldAll` which tries to get a fold for each row in the buffer. 

![screen shot 2015-11-06 at 14 33 40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/10998152/6ad7aa82-8493-11e5-9ac7-6674ee1a53f1.png)

This happens also on startup because grammars are loaded after a `TextEditor` instance gets created. Moreover, user's perceived responsiveness gets worse as more files (or larger files) need to be opened/restored because we change the grammar for every instance of `TextEditor` as soon as the packages' grammars are loaded and a new grammar is recognized.
### Solution

With this PR, instead of issuing a `findMarker` call to `TextBuffer` for each buffer row, we just get all the folds intersecting the whole buffer and destroy them in reverse order. This is how the first graph looks like after the improvements:

![screen shot 2015-11-06 at 13 22 04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/10998210/d2316e20-8493-11e5-9458-9c58ab169d3c.png)

Calling `::unfoldAll` is almost instantaneous now and for a single ~3000 lines file this saves almost `150ms`. :racehorse: :racehorse: :racehorse: 

In the same code path there's still some work we could do to make loading settings faster, as it would seem like we spend a considerable amount of time in just setting keys/values in `Config` (at least during startup). Nevertheless, this should result in a significant responsiveness increase when users boot up Atom with some open files.

/cc: @nathansobo @atom/feedback

data.title: List of activationCommands and activationHooks?
data.body:
In the "Hacking Atom" documentation, the [section on package.json](https://atom.io/docs/v1.1.0/hacking-atom-package-word-count#package-json) references `activationCommands` and `activationHooks`.

Is there a list of valid `activationCommands` and `activationHooks` that can be listened to in Atom?

For example, what should I listen to for my package's `activate` method to run when Atom first loads? How do I listen for when a user opens a file with extension `.txt` or `.text`? etc

data.title: Cursor offset by 1-2 spaces
data.body: after using atom for some time, it started offseting the cursor by 1 to 2 spaces so when i clicked somewhere it would be offset. I would also have to move the cursor out of the {} for example to type in it. The only fix was to completely uninstall atom and reinstall it.
